title: GH-7: Add 4k/other resolution variants (quick duplication approach)
DOC-3: Milestone D – Stage 3 sight renderer
description:
Per docs/refactor-plan.md, defer Stage 3 until after Stage 1/2 but capture the plan: replace WinForms sight generation with a structured renderer driven by Stage 2 outputs.

Tasks
- Design template-driven sight descriptions (per family) instead of ad-hoc strings in Tochka/Luch/Duga/etc.
- Consume JSON intermediates + ballistic tables without hitting WinForms-only state.
- Keep localization loading explicit and deterministic.
- Plan migration path so existing sight families continue to work while the WinForms UI thins out.

Done when sight generation runs headless (CLI or library) and WinForms no longer owns drawing logic.

title: DOC-4: Future GUI replacement after CLI split
description:
docs/refactor-plan.md (Future: full replacement of WinForms) asks for a modern GUI once Stage 1+2 are external.

Scope
- Evaluate Rust+Tauri vs .NET MAUI (or similar) for a thin front-end that shells out to the CLIs.
- Maintain headless/CI workflows while offering a friendlier desktop UX.
- Persist tool paths, datamine/output folders, thread/log settings in a modern config.
- Package GUI + CLI artifacts together with consistent versioning and checksums.

Done when WinForms can be retired and the new UI orchestrates Convert → Ballistic → Sights via external tools.

title: GH-2: Integrate local extraction with wt_ext_cli and feed existing conversion pipeline
GH-15: Update release workflow to support immutable releases
GH-23: Stage 1: WinForms Button1 integration (shell out to fcs)
DOC-2: Milestone C – Stage 2 CLI make-ballistic
description:
Ref docs/refactor-plan.md (Milestone C). Implement  csgen make-ballistic that consumes Stage 1 outputs (JSON + legacy) and emits deterministic Ballistic/{vehicle}/{shell}.txt tables.

Scope
- Port Ballistic(), HePenetration(), DeMarre logic into Rust with configurable constants (TOML).
- Parallelize per projectile for speed; ensure AP/APHE/APDS/APFSDS parity within 1% tolerance.
- Accept both JSON and legacy Data input, selecting projectiles intelligently (skip rockets/smoke).
- Provide CLI flags aligning with Stage 1 (threads, log level, emit options).
- Add CI coverage that compares outputs vs existing Ballistic/ examples for the validation corpus.

Done when Stage 1+2 can run headless and finish sample corpus <10s as stated in the roadmap.

title: GH-17: Stage 1: CLI scaffolding and args (tools/fcs, crates/core+cli)
GH-24: Repo layout: add tools/fcs workspace skeleton
DOC-5: Release packaging for CLI + WinForms artifacts
description:
docs/refactor-plan.md (Releases & packaging) calls for consistent artifacts once the CLIs land.

Tasks
- Produce zipped artifacts:  cs-stage1-v{version}-win-x64.zip (CLI, LICENSE, README, --help) and FCS-WinForms-v{version}-win-x64.zip.
- Publish SHA256 checksums per artifact and optionally Linux builds for the CLI.
- Align versioning between CLI + WinForms; ship docs/changelog snippets in the archives.
- Automate publishing in release workflow so we can ship per-milestone without manual bundling.

Done when we can cut repeatable releases with both CLI and WinForms assets from CI.

title: GH-20: Stage 1: Emit legacy Data/*.txt deterministically
DOC-1: Milestone B – integrate datamine extraction & caching
description:
doc/refactor-plan.md (Milestone B) describes the follow-up after Stage 1: integrate datamine extraction so the CLI no longer depends on committed assets.

Tasks
- Shell out to wt_ext_cli or embed a Rust extractor from within \ csgen convert-datamine\.
- Add a cache manifest (e.g., .fcs-cache.json) with datamine version, file hashes/mtimes to skip unchanged vehicles; expose --force and --status.
- Detect upstream datamine version and include it in output headers.
- Hash vehicle/module dependencies so incremental rebuilds only touch stale items.

Done when Stage 1 can fetch/extract inputs automatically and incremental rebuilds behave per the refactor plan.

title: DOC-6: Document beads↔GitHub workflow and reorganize docs
description:
Work tracked on branch  eads-init. Scope:
- Describe planner expectations (beads primary, GitHub mirroring) in AGENTS.md and docs overview.
- Establish naming/frontmatter guidance for docs and optionally a docs/README so specs are discoverable.
- Add instructions to keep docs in sync when code/CLI changes land.
- Treat this as the initial cleanup pass so future documentation/template work has a foundation.
